{"blocks":[{"key":"81vfj","text":"Incubate the activated membrane in distilled water for   on a shaker to rehydrate the membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvm3b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"59E1B730D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mpe8","text":"Soak the membrane in transfer buffer for 10-15 minutes prior to use to equilibrate the membrane with the buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6fat","text":"Assemble the transfer sandwich by placing the gel on top of the anode (black side), followed by a sponge soaked in transfer buffer, a piece of transfer paper, the PVDF membrane, another piece of transfer paper, a sponge soaked in transfer buffer, and finally the cathode (white side). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32a8h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3nm0s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3gnl","text":"Make sure the white side of the cassette is oriented towards the red electrode so the current passes through the gel to the membrane.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0j5f","text":"Transfer the proteins from the gel to the membrane by running the transfer at   at constant 400 mAmps for   ( ) or at constant 100 V for  , depending on the properties of the protein of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":109,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1r9hv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8E24C640D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"921F2560D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"D2A69990D3AD11ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"96B80E70D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqdp3","text":"After transfer, incubate the blots in   of blocking solution (such as 1X TBS + 5% non-fat milk + 5% goat serum) for   at   on a rocker to block nonspecific binding sites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":116,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4k8ke","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"6","error":false,"guid":"A62F8F40D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"ABE273D0D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AFA6F5E0D3A611ED8706C1C9596EE4BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51gfb","text":"Anesthetize mice using isoflurane (SomnoSuite Small Animal Anesthesia System, Kent Scientific; induction 2.5%, maintenance 0.8–1.4% in O2, 0.35 l/min). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ceoic","text":"Fix the head of the mouse on a stereotaxic frame (Kopf Instruments, Tujunga, CA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9aq3g","text":"Apply Puralube vet ointment on the eye to prevent cornea from drying out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcea5","text":"Use a stereotactic drill (0.8 mm) to perform a craniotomy (unilateral, right) to target the midbrain and dorsal striatum with the following coordinates (values are in mm from Bregma):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dtbov","text":"Place an Ag/AgCl reference electrode via a saline bridge under the skin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8f8g8","text":"Lower a 22G bipolar stimulating electrode (P1 Technologies, VA, USA) to target ventral midbrain (between 4-4.5mm). Adjust the exact depth for maximal dopamine release.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1cq","text":"Lower a custom-built carbon fiber electrode (5 μm diameter, cut to ∼150 μm length, Hexcel Corporation, CT, USA) to reach dorsal striatum for recording the evoked dopamine release.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhrcv","text":"Use dil-coated carbon-fiber electrodes to identify the electrode position in the dorsal striatum and the electrode track in the brain tissue to identify the position of the stimulation electrode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4i7cg","text":"Measure the evoked dopamine release using constant current (400μA), delivered using an Iso-Flex stimulus isolator triggered by a Master-9 pulse generator (AMPI, Jerusalem, Israel). A single burst stimulation consists of 30 pulses at 50Hz (0.6s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Surgery and in vivo Fast Scanning Cyclic Voltammetry (FSCV)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"56ols","text":"Calibrate electrodes using a known concentration of dopamine in artificial cerebrospinal fluid (ACSF).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
